page.title: 08MY FAVOURITE HOLIDAY PASTIME
page.content: MY SISTER ELIZABETH AND I GET UP AT 8 AM IN THE MORNING TO RIDE OUR HORSE RASCAL.WE RIDE HIM UP AND DOWN THE FIELD TO EXERCISE HIM.THEN WE LET HIM OUT IN THE FIELD TO EAT SOME GRASS. WE LEAVE HIM FOR AN HOUR OR TWO.THEN WE GO INTO THE HOUSE AND CLEAN THE TACK.FOR THE SADDLE WE NEED A SOAP CALLED SADDLE SOAP.WE JUST RUB A BIT ON EACH PART AND RUB IT INTO THE SADDLE.TO CLEAN THE REINS WE NEED A SPECIAL MIXTURE.IT IS A CAN OF OIL- LIKE MIXTURE.I RUB IT ON THE LEATHER AND THE DIRT COMES OUT.WHEN WE HAVE FINISHED WE PUT THE HORSE AWAY INTO HIS STABLE.AT TEA TIME WE LEAD HIM OUT AGAIN.THIS TIME WE TROT AND CANTER HIM.THEN WE PUT HIM AWAY AND GROOM HIM.FIRST WE WASH THE SWEAT OFF HIM WITH A SPONGE,THEN WE PULL HIS MANE THAT MEANS PULL IT TO ONE SIDE.THEN WE PULL HIS TAIL WHICH IS TO PULL IT
